defs: transcending the influence of divine illusion.
he who is not or cannot be influenced by divine illusion.
a man reeling under the influence of illusion; a spiritually ignorant man.
the wand of a magician; a magic-wand.
a type of device having an enclosed lamp and a lenslike opening, formerly used for projecting and magnifying still pictures or images mounted on slides or films; a magic lantern.
a sleep induced by magical power.
the attachment of infatuating love or affection.
(vīr.) illusion or infatuation considered as an impediment in the path of realisation.
the plant Quercus lusitanica ( = Q. infectoria) of Gagaceae family.
its fruit; magic nut.
an organised net-work created deliberately to cheat people.
= ಮಾಯಾಬಜಾರ.
the apparent perception of an external object or sense-datum when no such object or stimulus is present; an instance of this; hallucination.
he who dispels illusion, hallucination, ignorance; a spiritual teacher or the Supreme Being.
that which pollutes the soul, as a sinful act, infatuation, ignorance, etc.
a kind of mask used as an insignia by a king, head of a monastery, etc.
the course of ignorance that leads to illusion, hullucination, infatuation, etc.

a spiritually ignorant man.
a destroyer of illusion, hullucination, ignorance, etc.; the Supreme Being or a spiritual teacher.

a person who is supposed to use an evil supernatural power over people and their affairs; a wizard; a sorcerer.
an expert magician.
a person who tricks; a cheat; a trickster.
the act, profession of a sorcerer.
the tendency or habitual practice of cheating.
the influence of ignorance that keeps a person from realising the truth.

loving; affectionate; emotionally attached to.
an affectionate, loving person.
a very innocent person.

tending to cheat; cheating; deceitful.
easily mistaken for something else; deceptive; illusory.

a false idea or conception; belief or opinion not in accord with the facts.
any event, circumstance or experience that is apparent to the senses but not true.
the Supreme Being who creates this divine illusion.
he who has transcended the influence of illusion, ignorance, etc.
